metadata.title: CVE-2024-35793 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:debugfs: fix wait/cancellation handling during remove Ben Greear furtherreports deadlocks during concurrent debugfs remove while files are beingaccessed, even though the code in question now uses debugfs cancellations.Turns out that despite all the review on the locking, we missed completelythat the logic is wrong: if the refcount hits zero we can finish (and neednot wait for the completion), but if it doesn't we have to trigger all thecancellations. As written, we can _never_ get into the loop triggering thecancellations. Fix this, and explain it better while at it.

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-starfive package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
